abstract: Yelp reports surprise net loss of $1.3 million in its fiscal second quarter, down from profit of $2.7 million in year-earlier period; also projects third-quarter revenue of $139 million to $142 million, down from analyst projection of $152.6 million.
lead_paragraph: The company reported its slowest revenue growth in 18 quarters and said its chairman, Max Levchin, would step down “to pursue other interests.”

headline.main: Yelp Posts Surprise Loss as Revenue Growth Slows
headline.print_headline: Yelp Posts Surprise Loss as Revenue Growth Slows

snippet: The company reported its slowest revenue growth in 18 quarters and said its chairman, Max Levchin, would step down “to pursue other interests.”
